1.text: My son, attend to my wisdom; incline thine ear to understanding:

2.text: To watch meditation, and thy lips shall guard knowledge.

3.text: For the lips of the strange woman will drop droppings of the honeycomb, and her palate is smooth above oil:

4.text: And her latter state being bitter as wormwood; sharp as a two-mouthed sword.

5.text: Her feet go down to death; her steps will hold fast to hades.

6.text: Lest thou shalt make level the path of life, her tracks wavered; thou wilt not know.

7.text: And now, ye sons, hear to me, and ye shall not depart from the words of my mouth.

8.text: Remove far off from her thy way, and thou shalt not draw near to the door of her house:

9.text: Lest thou shalt give thy strength to others, and thy years to the cruel:

10.text: Lest strangers shall be filled with thy strength, and thy labors in the house of strangers;

11.text: And thou didst lament in thy latter state, in the consuming of thy flesh and thy fulness,

12.text: And thou saidst, How did I hate instruction, and my heart despise reproofs.

13.text: And I heard not to the voice of him teaching me, and I inclined not mine ear to him instructing me.

14.text: As I was almost in all evil in the midst of the convocation and the assembly.

15.text: Drink water from thy pit, and flowing from the midst of thy well.

16.text: Thy fountains shall be dispersed without; in the broad places streams of waters.

17.text: They shall be to thee alone, and not strangers with thee.

18.text: Thy fountain shall be blessed: and rejoice from the wife of thy youth.

19.text: The hind of loves and the wild goat of grace; her breasts shall satiate thee in all time; thou shalt always wander in her loves.

20.text: And wherefore, my son, wilt thou wander with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

21.text: For before the eyes of Jehovah are the ways of man, and he makes level all his tracks.

22.text: His iniquities shall take the unjust one, and with the cords of his sins shall he be held fast.

23.text: He shall die in not being instructed, and he shall wander in the multitude of his folly.
